intro: Dimorphocalyx balakrishnanii, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Western Ghats of India and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a slightly glossy texture. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height. The flowers are not only ornamental but also attract a variety of pollinators such as bees and birds.
